intro: Dichapetalum madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar star apple, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Madagascar, characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces fleshy, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
